name: Frack'n Gnomes!
description:
In the past few years, the state of Ohio, USA has experienced an increased number of earthquakes. Scientists point to fracking in the state as a possible cause of these earthquakes. While the people on the surface find this to be a major inconvenience, we're here to tell the story of a people who are much more affected by the fracking. The unknown underground Gnome societies of Ohio.

In Frack'n Gnomes!, you play as one of these gnomes trying to escape through pitch-black tunnels from the incoming fracking drill. Luckily, all gnomes have echolocation (duh), which you can use to "see" the walls and platforms around you.

Run, jump, and fall your way until your inevitable demise (and get a high score!)

Credits:

This game was made as part of the Global Game Jam program. The venue was graciously organized by the University of Utah Entertainment Arts and Engineering department. All team members were students in the EAE Program.

All Intellectual Property is owned by the team and published by Sky Pulse LLC.
